item.title: Report X-2023080934
item.description:
Report X-2023080934

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: MOUNT JULIET
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: JAMB ON IC BELT CAUSED BACKING AND PACKAGES BEING KNOCKED/DROPPED OF BELT. PACKAG WAS UPRIGHTED, PLACED IN TOTE AND SPILLED ACID WAS FUTHER CLEANED UP. DescribePack: CAP BECAME MISALIGNED FROM WEIGHT OF PACKAGE DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE MOVED TO HAZMAT CAGE - OUTER PACKING SEPERATED FROM INNER PACKING AS OUTER PACKING WAS STILL SMOKING AND REACTIVE TO ACID RELEASE. ALL PLACED IN TOTE LINED WITH NEAUTRIZING POWEDER AND PLACED UNDER HOOD.

item.title: Report E-2023090004
item.description:
Report E-2023090004

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-31
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal NKX experienced a UN3105 Norox MCP-75 Red release from a 5-gallon jerrican. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting an 8’ x 10’ area of the trailer floor and a 10’ x 10’ area of the concrete lot below due to the pail being crushed as a result of stacking. Oil dri was deployed onto the impacted areas and worked into to clean and remove all free-standing liquid. The damaged empty jug, absorbents, PPE, and spill pads were then collected into a 55-gallon vented poly drum. An impacted pallet was also cut up and placed into a separate 55-gallon vented poly drum. Both drums were submerged with water per XPO’s waste vendor requirements. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

Report E-2023080990

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of paint (un1263) had been crushed and that 3 of the inner metal one gallon cans had released 2 cups of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Wet fully regulated fiberboard box found on HMPA pallet within tote. Events prior unknown. DescribePack: One of one 2.5 gallon plastic jerrican lost 1.3 gallons from pinhole puncture to bottom of body (not on seam) from sharp protruding object during transit. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE was donned and ventilation was utilized.

item.title: Report X-2023080793
item.description:
Report X-2023080793

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-07T15:11:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-07
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Fiberboard box found leaking in tote on HMPA pallet. Events prior unknown. Overpack label was noticed on outer box but when inner content was inspected, no UNPOP markings were found. DescribePack: One of four 1 gallon plastic bottles lost 0.2 gallon due a loose cap closure. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The hazmat was placed in a lined and lidded tote. PPE and ventilation was utilized.

item.title: Report X-2023080414
item.description:
Report X-2023080414

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 07/21/2023 at approximately 2115, Dangerous Goods Administration recieved a call from Employee 245975 at the hub facility in Memphis, reporting an alcohol spill. The shipment was 54 fiberboard boxes overpacked on a pallet. One of the boxes showed signs of liquid damage. Further inspection reavealed that the bottle inside of the box had completely leaked, cause umknown the damaged package was removed from the overpack and set for disposal and the remaining pieces of the shipment await an amended shipper's declaration for further disposition.

item.title: Report X-2023080403
item.description:
Report X-2023080403

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-30
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704649 PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704660 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704671 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=589295704693 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=No Release TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1170 CLASS=30 PSN TEXT=ETHANOL SOLUTION PKG GRP=III )On July 30th 6 jerricans containing UN1170, ETHANOL SOLUTION, 3, III were found to be compromised. Two of the jerricans leaked some of the liquid contained inside, and the other four only had an odor. We are unable to determine the source of the leak on the two jerricans. All were placed into salvage drums and are awaiting disposition and amended shippers declarations if necessary, from the shipper.

item.title: Report X-2023080007
item.description:
Report X-2023080007

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-21
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A Memphis spill agent was called to the dangerous goods building for a leaking package. The agent was given a fiberboard box containing a class 9. The fiberboard box contained four metal cans seperated by a fiberboard divider. One of the cans was dented causing the lid to open and release all of its contents inside of the box. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report X-2023071232
item.description:
Report X-2023071232

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-13T18:13:54+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-07-11
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 11 this package was discovered leaking prior to the sort process. The package contained UN1591, 0-DICHLOROBENZENE, 6.1, III. One of the inner receptacles broke during transit and leaked the contents. The package was placed into a steel salvage drum and the shipper was contacted to provide an amended shippers declaration.
